definition: to be jealous of/fear/dread/scruple/to avoid or abstain from/to quit/to give up sth

sentences.english: He must exert himself to subdue so proud a display of resentment .
sentences.chinese: 他必须施展本事，征服这种因忌恨而产生的骄傲。

sentences.english: Xiao Ming harbors great hate for the classmate who beat him last time.
sentences.chinese: 小明非常忌恨上次打他的那个同学。

sentences.english: His hostility to the woman found vent in a sharp remark.
sentences.chinese: 他用尖刻的话来发泄对那个女人的忌恨。

sentences.english: When someone holds a grudge against you , it teaches you that everyone makes mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 当有人忌恨你的时候，他教你懂得每个人都会犯错。

sentences.english: Only those beneath me can envy or hate me.
sentences.chinese: 只有那些比我更卑微者才会羡慕或忌恨我。

sentences.english: Love me, hate me, but can't you see what I see.
sentences.chinese: 爱上我，忌恨我，但你无法瞧见我所眼见的。

definition: to hate out of jealousy/to resent
to feel hatred/to harbor a grudge
to be suspicious and jealous of
to be jealous of (sb's achievements etc)/to be envious/envy
to hate and resent/angry and full of grievances
to be jealous of (sb's achievements etc)/to be envious/envy
to resent/to harbor a grudge against/to loathe/resentment/rancor
variant of 憤恨|愤恨[fen4 hen4]
to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
to frame/to bring false charges against
